description: The Somalian government announced that schools and universities would resume on August 15. UPDATE: The closure of schools and universities announced on 17th March 2020 will end. The Government has announced that schools and universities would resume on 15 August.

description: The Somalian government has imposed a night curfew between the hours of 8 pm to 5 am in the country's capital Mogadishu. The curfew will commence from the 15th of April 2020.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: On 15th March 2020, Somalia government announced that travellers originating from or transiting through worst countries (China, Itan, Italy and South Korea) in the last 14 days would not be allowed into the country.
type_sub_cat: Travel History Form (e.g. documents where traveler has recently been)
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: On 16th March 2020, Somali Aviation Ministry ordered a suspension of all international flights for 15 days starting from Wednesday, 18 March 2020, with exception to humanitarian flights.
On April 9, authorities in the Gedo region ordered the closure of land border crossings with Kenya and Ethiopia.
target_geog_level: One or more countries and one or more regional groupings

description: The Somali government announced that international flights would resume as of Monday, August 3. UPDATE: The original suspension on all International Flights will end, the Somali government announced that international flights would resume as of Monday, August 3.

On 28th March 2020, Somalia government in announcing that its Ministry of Transport and Aviation will extend its ban on international flights from Sunday 29th, banned all the local flights from 29th March.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: On 15th March 2020, Somalia government urged all travellers to comply with health screening.
type_text: Health screening of travellers does not fit the descriptions of Health Monitoring or Health Testing as provided in the survey.

description: According to information published on 27th February 2020 by the US Embassy on its Country Information and Travel Advisory page, Somalia authorities have established a quarantine unit at Aden Adde International Airport in Mogadishu to isolate arriving passengers who have recently traveled to China and for those that demonstrate symptoms of coronavirus. Somali nationals who have been to China in the two weeks prior to landing will automatically be quarantined upon arrival in Somalia.
type_sub_cat: Government Quarantine (i.e. quarantine at a government hotel or facility)
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: On 17th March 2020, Somalia government prohibited mass gatherings.

On 31st March 2020, Somalia government ordered the closure of all religious schools or madrassas in an effort to contain the spread of coronavirus. It further urged people to pray from home for the next 2 weeks instead of going to the mosque.
